nl_problem:
# Task: matrix_chain_multiplication
# Interface:
Class: Solution
Method: matrixChainOrder(self, arg1)

Given a list of matrix dimensions, find the minimum number of scalar multiplications needed to multiply the sequence of matrices.
If the sequence of matrices is A1, A2, ..., An, where Ai has dimensions `p[i-1] x p[i]`, the input is the list `p = [p0, p1, ..., pn]`.

Constraints:
- 2 <= p.length <= 100
- 1 <= p[i] <= 100
lisp_spec:
(task
  (name "matrixChainOrder")
  (signature ( (self Solution) (arg1 (list int)) ) int)
  (constraints
    (constraint "2 <= p.length <= 100")
    (constraint "1 <= p[i] <= 100")
  )
  (goal
    (description "Find the minimum number of scalar multiplications needed to multiply the sequence of matrices.")
    (rule "The input is the list p = [p0, p1, ..., pn] where Ai has dimensions p[i-1] x p[i].")
    (return "The minimum number of scalar multiplications needed.")
  ))
